column4: Hi guys.. I have trouble getting my wireless to work.. this is my wireless device..saurabh@saurabh-laptop:~$ lspci | grep w
04:00.0 Network controller: Broadcom Corporation BCM4312 802.11b/g (rev 01)
I followed steps on http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/wireless-internet/159161-solved-wireless-ubuntu-9-10-lenovo-laptop.html
but my STI driver isn't getting loaded at boot time! :(
can anyone help?
Hi can anyone help me getting my wireless to work on 9.10?
@spaztic: yes.. But through wired connection
@Spaztic_One: yes.. But through wired connection
didnt get u @ortsvorsteher
did you followed the link ubottu gave you? does it help?
does it work now?
nope. Seems like the driver is not getting loaded.. cause it does show in my system > administration > hardware drivers.. but its not activated and nothing happens even if i click on activate
I thought adding wl to /etc/modules would do it
yes, this will be a part of the work...
my wlan devices works in ubuntu 8.04 and i dont know you hardware details, so i cannot help. sorry. i also followed the procedure and it worked for me
Ohh! so do i have to wait untill lucid is out?
i dont hope so. is your device blacklisted?
04:00.0 Network controller: Broadcom Corporation BCM4312 802.11b/g (rev 01) thats the O/P of my lspci | grep w
how do i check if it is blacklisted?
did you look at the blacklist/whitelist? if not, have a look...
No i didn't.. how to access it?
i looked at http://wiki.ubuntuusers.de if you are not familiar with german language, you have to find an english ubuntu forum
hope you find somethin
